info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 2 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties.
North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County.
For the Wabash River...including Linn Grove, Bluffton IN, Wabash, Logansport...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Auglaize River...including Fort Jennings, Defiance...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Elkhart River...including Goshen, Cosperville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Auglaize River near Fort Jennings.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins along the Auglaize River with secondary roads and agricultural lands as well as homes nearest the river being affected by flood waters. Some evacuations of people and property may be necessary.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.8 feet Friday evening. It will then fall to 11.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon to 15.5 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 545 AM EDT.
